intro: Oldfeltia polyphlebia, commonly known as the Sierra foothill buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible seeds. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in shades of white or pale pink. Oldfeltia polyphlebia plays an important ecological role by providing nectar for pollinators and stabilizing soils in its native range.
